title: dated futuristic type font - any ideas anyone?
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317170800im_/http:/typophile.com/files/666bet_6124.jpg)

Font: 

 Eurostile Bold Extended 

Solved By: 

 [kthomps5](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317170800/http:/typophile.com/user/175823 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |

author: chestnut

comments.content:
Looks like Eurostile Bold Extended with a heavy stroke applied to close up the counters:

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/eurostile/bold-extended-2-63893/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317170800/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/eurostile/bold-extended-2-63893/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/eurostile/bold-extended-2-63893/")

There are fonts similar to the BET in your sample, but the numerals don't match on any of them. Here's one:

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/q-bo/spac3/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317170800/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/q-bo/spac3/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/q-bo/spac3/")
Thank you kthomps5, Eurostile Bold Extended with heavy stroke it is

Can't explain why but feels "freebie" to me... Some more possible candidates for (easy) customization: [Ferry](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317170800/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/autodidakt/ferry) LfS and **[Coulson](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317170800/http:/www.dafont.com/coulson.font)** (probably my choice, very close, only needing gaps to be filled)  
Coulton, gaps filled

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317170800im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Untitled-1_5909.png)
